This file implements a unified service for generating, storing, and managing OpenAI embeddings for various content types (e.g., store listings, agents) in a database. It provides functions for creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting these embeddings to enable semantic search capabilities.

This file contains integration tests for content handlers and embedding-related functionalities. It verifies the handlers' interaction with a real database and filesystem, using mocked OpenAI calls for embedding generation.

This file contains integration tests for the hybrid search feature, verifying its correct functionality across different database schemas, with various filters, custom weights, and graceful degradation when embeddings are unavailable.

This file contains unit tests for the embeddings module, which handles the generation, storage, retrieval, and management of vector embeddings for store content. It covers functionality such as building searchable text, interacting with the OpenAI API for embedding generation, and database operations for storing and fetching embeddings.

This file defines an abstract base class for content handlers and concrete implementations (e.g., for store agents and blocks). These handlers are part of a pluggable system designed to fetch, process, and prepare different content types for unified embedding generation, as well as to report on embedding coverage statistics.

This file defines custom exception classes for handling various errors related to media uploads and store operations within the backend API. It includes specific exceptions for file types, sizes, storage issues, virus detection, and store entity not found scenarios.

This file provides utility functions for managing user media (images and videos) by handling uploads to and existence checks against Google Cloud Storage, including file type, size, signature validation, and virus scanning.

This file contains unit tests for the media upload functionality (specifically `upload_media`) within the backend API. It covers various scenarios including successful uploads for different media types, invalid file types, size limits, and storage configuration errors, utilizing mocks for external services like Google Cloud Storage.

This file contains a unit test for the `LibraryAgentPreset` model, specifically testing its `from_db` method to ensure correct conversion and mapping of data from a Prisma database model (`AgentPreset`).
This file handles database operations for managing a user's library of agents, including listing, searching, sorting, and retrieving individual agents, potentially linking to marketplace listings.

This file contains asynchronous unit tests for database operations related to managing a user's library agents, including listing agents and adding agents from a store listing. It heavily utilizes mocking to simulate Prisma ORM interactions.
This file defines blocks for managing agents within a user's personal library, including adding agents from a marketplace and listing existing library agents.

This file contains unit tests for backend blocks that interact with an agent store and library. It verifies functionalities such as searching for agents, retrieving agent details, and adding agents from the store to a user's library.

This file defines the main client-side page for the 'Library' section of the AutoGPT Platform. It orchestrates the display of a list of items (likely agents), including search, sorting, and a dedicated section for favorites.

This directory is intended to store custom React hooks, which encapsulate reusable stateful logic or side effects for the frontend application. These hooks would serve as a library of shared functionalities accessible across various components within the platform's user interface.

This file defines a React hook (`useLibraryListPage`) that manages state and URL query parameters for a library listing page. It handles search functionality, uploaded files, and sorting options for library agents, ensuring a default sort parameter is always present in the URL.
This React component provides a search bar for the library section of the application, enabling users to search for agents. It handles user input to update the search term.

This file defines a custom React hook `useLibrarySearchbar` for handling debounced search input in a library search bar. It delays updating the search term until the user pauses typing, optimizing performance.
This file defines the `LibraryActionHeader` React component, which provides a search bar and an agent upload dialog for the library section, with responsive layouts for desktop and mobile.

This file defines the FavoritesSection component, which displays a scrollable list of a user's favorited agents. It fetches favorite agents using a custom hook and renders them as cards within an infinite scroll container.
This file defines a custom React hook `useLibrarySortMenu` that provides functions to handle sorting changes for library items and retrieve display labels for different sort options.
This file defines the `LibrarySortMenu` React component, which provides a dropdown menu for sorting library items, specifically agents, by creation date or last modified date.

This file defines a React component, `LibraryActionSubHeader`, which serves as a sub-header for a library section. It displays the count of agents and provides a sorting mechanism through a `LibrarySortMenu` component.

This file defines a React page component for displaying a legacy agent's library view, likely identified by an ID in the URL. It serves as an entry point for rendering the OldAgentLibraryView component.

This file implements the final 'congratulations' step of the onboarding process, displaying celebratory animations, marking the onboarding as complete, and automatically adding a selected marketplace agent to the user's library before redirecting them.

This file contains Playwright end-to-end tests for the 'Library' section of the AutoGPT frontend application, covering functionalities like page loading, agent display, pagination, searching, and agent uploading.
This file defines the Playwright Page Object Model (POM) for the AutoGPT frontend's 'library' page, providing methods to interact with agents (search, sort, view, upload) for end-to-end tests.

This file defines a React component that provides a UI element (a button with a share icon) allowing users to publish an agent (identified by `flowID`) to a marketplace, using a modal for the publishing process.

This file defines a React custom hook, `usePublishToMarketplace`, which manages the state and logic for a multi-step process of publishing an application or component to a marketplace. It provides functions to open the publishing modal, manage its steps, and update submission data.

This file defines a React component `BecomeACreator` which displays a section encouraging users to publish their AI agents. It includes a title, a descriptive paragraph, and a button that triggers an agent publishing modal.

This file defines the user profile page component for the AutoGPT frontend. It fetches and displays the user's profile information, handles loading and error states, and allows for profile updates via a form.
This file defines the main page component for the user's dashboard. It renders the 'MainDashboardPage' component and sets the browser tab title to 'Creator Dashboard  AutoGPT Platform'.
This file defines a React hook (`useMainDashboardPage`) that manages the state and logic for a user's dashboard, allowing them to view, publish, edit, and delete their store submissions.
This React component displays a message indicating that no agents have been submitted yet, providing a visual cue and instructions for the user to get started with agent submissions.
This React component renders the main user dashboard, displaying a list of uploaded AI agents. It provides functionalities for submitting new agents and managing (editing/deleting) existing ones.

This React component (`BecomeACreator`) provides a call-to-action section encouraging users to become creators by building and sharing their AI agents. It presents a title, description, and a button that triggers a modal for publishing an agent.

This React component displays a visual status badge, using different colors and text based on the provided submission status (e.g., 'Draft', 'Approved', 'Rejected'). It maps `SubmissionStatus` enum values to Tailwind CSS classes for styling.

This file defines a React component (`ProfileInfoForm`) that allows users to view and edit their profile information, including display name, username, bio, avatar, and social links. It interacts with a backend API to update these details.
This file defines the main Marketplace page for the AutoGPT platform, handling data prefetching for agents and creators, SEO metadata, and rendering the marketplace components.
This file provides the loading state UI for the marketplace page, rendering a dedicated loading component while the page content is being fetched.
This file defines a React component that displays a loading skeleton for the main marketplace page. It uses `Skeleton` components to indicate content is being loaded.

This file defines the `CreatorPageLoading` React component, which displays a skeleton loading state for a creator's profile page. It uses `Skeleton` components to render placeholders for various elements like text, images, and content blocks while data is being fetched.
This file defines a React component that displays a loading state for the main search results page in the marketplace, using skeleton placeholders to indicate content being loaded.

This file defines the `CreatorCard` React component, which displays a creator's profile information such as their name, image, bio, and the number of agents they have uploaded, intended for use in a marketplace UI.
This file provides a utility function to cycle through a predefined set of Tailwind CSS background colors, intended for dynamic styling of UI components like creator cards.
This file defines a React hook `useFilterChips` for managing the state and logic of filter chips, allowing for single or multi-selection and providing a callback for filter changes.

This file defines a React component called `FilterChips` which renders a set of clickable badges (chips) that function as filters. It allows users to select multiple filters and triggers a callback when selections change.

This file defines an array of Tailwind CSS background color classes and provides a utility function to cyclically retrieve a color based on an index, likely for UI elements in the marketplace section.

This file defines a React hook (`useFeaturedSection`) that provides logic for navigating through a list of 'featured agents', likely for a carousel or slider component. It includes functions to advance to the next or previous slide.
This component renders a carousel displaying a list of 'featured agents' for the marketplace. Each agent is presented as a card within the carousel, linking to their individual detail page.
This file defines a React hook (`useFeaturedCreators`) for managing and displaying a limited set of featured creators, including navigation logic for viewing a specific creator's profile.

This React component displays a list of featured creators, rendering each creator using a `CreatorCard` component within a responsive grid layout. It leverages a custom hook `useFeaturedCreators` for managing creator display logic.
This file defines default search terms used in the Hero Section component of the marketplace frontend. It provides a list of predefined categories or keywords for initial display or suggestions.
This file defines the HeroSection component for a marketplace, displaying a prominent title, a search bar, and filter chips for exploring AI agents.

This file defines a React hook (`useHeroSection`) for the marketplace hero section, managing onboarding step completion, retrieving marketplace search terms (possibly from feature flags), and handling navigation for search filter changes.

This React component displays a list of external links provided by a creator. It normalizes URLs, extracts hostnames, and renders them as clickable buttons with corresponding social media or website icons.

This file defines a custom React hook `useSearchbar` that manages the state and submission logic for a search bar. It handles user input, encodes the search term, and navigates to the marketplace search results page upon submission.

This file defines the `SearchBar` React component, which provides a customizable search input field for the marketplace interface. It handles user input and search submission, leveraging a custom hook for search logic.

This file defines the main marketplace page component, orchestrating the display of featured agents, top agents, featured creators, and a 'Become a Creator' section. It manages data fetching, loading states, and error handling for the marketplace content.

This file defines a React hook `useMainMarketplacePage` responsible for fetching and managing data for the marketplace, including featured agents, top agents, and featured creators, utilizing API calls with caching strategies.

This file contains an integration test for the `MainMarketplacePage` component, verifying its rendering and interaction with mocked API responses. It's specifically noted as a temporary test for CI purposes.

This component renders the main search results page for a marketplace, displaying filtered and sorted listings of agents and creators based on a user's search query. It includes UI for search input, filters, sorting, and handles loading/error states.

This file defines a React hook for managing the main search results page in a marketplace, handling API calls to fetch agents and creators, and providing state and functions for filtering and client-side sorting of these results.
This file defines a React hook (`useMainCreatorPage`) responsible for fetching and managing the state of a creator's details and their published agents for a marketplace page.

This React component renders the main page for a specific creator in the marketplace. It displays the creator's information, description, links, and a list of agents associated with them, handling loading and error states.

This file defines the `CreatorInfoCard` React component, which displays a card containing detailed information about a creator, including their avatar, username, handle, top categories, average rating, and total runs. It is designed for use in a marketplace or profile section to showcase creator profiles.

This file defines the `StoreCard` React component, a reusable UI element for displaying detailed information about an agent or item in a marketplace, including its image, name, creator, description, usage statistics (runs), and rating.
This client-side Next.js page component renders the marketplace search interface, processing URL query parameters for search terms and sorting criteria to display relevant store agent results.

This file defines a Next.js page for displaying a specific creator's profile in a marketplace, including their details and associated agents. It pre-fetches data on the server and dynamically generates metadata for the page.
This React component displays a star rating, including a numerical value and visual stars (full, half, or empty) based on a given rating.
Playwright tests for the frontend marketplace page, covering basic functionality like page access, section visibility, navigation, and search features, including an edge case for non-existent items.

This file contains Playwright end-to-end tests for the AutoGPT marketplace creator profile page. It verifies basic functionality such as accessing creator pages when logged in or out, checking for visible details, and navigating to agents listed on a creator's page.

This file defines a Playwright Page Object Model for the 'Marketplace' page of the application. It provides methods to navigate to the marketplace, interact with UI elements like search bars and filters, and locate specific sections or cards (agents, creators) for end-to-end testing.

This file defines a React component named `RatingCard` that provides a user interface for submitting star ratings for an AutoGPT agent. It allows users to select a rating, displays corresponding text, and sends the rating to a backend API.
This file defines the `CreatorCard` React component, which displays a creator's name, image, bio, and the number of agents they have uploaded in a customizable card format.

This file defines the `StoreCard` React component, which is used to display a card for an 'agent' or item in a store or marketplace. It showcases an agent's image, name, creator, description, run count, and star rating in a visually appealing format.

This file defines a reusable SearchBar React component for the frontend of an AutoGPT application. It allows users to input search queries, which are then used to navigate to a marketplace search results page.

This React component displays a card providing detailed information about a creator, including their avatar, username, handle, top categories, average rating, and total number of runs. It's likely used on a profile or listing page.

This React component, `CreatorLinks`, displays a list of external links provided as an array of URLs. It extracts the hostname and renders a corresponding social icon for each link, presenting them as clickable buttons under an 'Other links' heading.

This React component renders a set of clickable filter chips (e.g., "All", "Agents", "Creators") to allow users to filter search results. It displays the count for each category and highlights the currently selected filter, triggering a callback on change.

This file contains helper functions specifically designed for frontend components interacting with a marketplace, providing utilities for version management, user role checking, and agent update status calculation.

Integration & Block Library.description: An extensive library of pre-built functional modules (blocks) that provide connectivity to hundreds of third-party services, AI models, and data manipulation tools, serving as the building blocks for agent workflows.

files.description: This directory is designated to store image assets specifically for documentation content related to Ollama within the AutoGPT project. Its purpose is to centralize visual aids for the `ollama` section of the documentation.

This document provides instructions on how to set up and integrate Ollama with the AutoGPT platform, including prerequisites, various setup methods (desktop app, Docker, CLI), and steps for using Ollama within AutoGPT. It also covers advanced topics like adding custom models and troubleshooting common issues.
This file provides instructions on how to find and utilize voice IDs from ElevenLabs, Microsoft Azure, and Amazon Polly for the D-ID CreateTalkingAvatarClip Block.

This document provides a step-by-step guide on how to integrate and use the AI/ML API with the AutoGPT platform for AI text generation. It covers setup, configuration of AI models, API keys, and running/saving agents.
This document provides a guide on integrating and using various Large Language Model (LLM) providers with AutoGPT, specifically detailing the Llama API and its available models.

This guide provides instructions on how to use various voice providers, including ElevenLabs, Microsoft Azure, and Amazon Polly, with the D-ID Create Talking Avatar Video block by specifying the correct voice IDs.
This document describes the 'AI Shortform Video Creator' integration block, detailing its functionality, inputs, outputs, and a practical use case for generating short-form videos using AI.

This document describes the AI Condition Block, a component that leverages large language models (LLMs) to evaluate natural language conditions. It details its functionality, inputs, outputs, use cases, and advantages over traditional conditional logic.
This document describes the Flux Kontext integration block, detailing its functionality for text-based image editing using BlackForest Labs' models, its inputs, outputs, and use cases within AutoGPT.
This document describes the Ideogram Model block, an AI-powered image generation tool, detailing its functionality, inputs, outputs, and potential use cases within a larger system.
This document describes blocks for processing and manipulating video and audio files, including operations like adding audio to video, looping videos, and retrieving media duration.
This file documents the Replicate Flux Advanced Model block, an AI-powered tool for generating images from text prompts. It details its functionality, inputs, outputs, and a potential use case.

This file documents various blocks for interacting with Large Language Models (LLMs), including functionalities for AI conversations, image generation, video creation, and intelligent condition evaluation.
This document describes the 'Unreal Text to Speech' integration block, detailing its functionality, inputs, outputs, and a potential use case for converting text to spoken audio.

This document explains the Claude Code block integration, detailing how it allows users to delegate complex coding tasks to Anthropic's Claude Code AI within a secure E2B sandbox environment. It covers the block's functionality, inputs, outputs, and potential use cases for automated code generation and development.

This file documents a block integration for creating talking avatar videos using the D-ID service. It outlines the functionality, input/output parameters, and a practical use case for generating video content with a digital avatar speaking a given script.

This file describes blocks for generating dynamic images with text overlays using Bannerbear templates. It's designed to add text overlays to images for purposes like social media graphics, marketing materials, and dynamic image content.

This file documents the Jina Embeddings block, which is used for generating text embeddings using Jina AI's models. It details how the block works, its inputs, outputs, and various use cases like semantic search and document clustering.

This file documents the 'Jina Fact Checker' block, which uses Jina AI's Grounding API to verify the factuality of statements. It outlines its functionality, inputs, outputs, and potential use cases like content verification and AI output validation.

This file documents the Jina Chunking integration, detailing how it splits text into semantically meaningful chunks using Jina AI's segmentation service. It explains its functionality, inputs, outputs, and various use cases, particularly for RAG and embedding preparation.

This file documents the integration of Nvidia AI blocks for detecting deepfakes and synthetic image manipulation. It details how the Nvidia Deepfake Detect block analyzes images and provides a probability score for manipulation.
Documentation for blocks that generate images using Flux models on Replicate with advanced settings, detailing inputs, outputs, and use cases.

This document describes AutoGPT's Replicate Block, detailing how to integrate and run AI models from the Replicate platform. It outlines the block's functionality, required inputs, expected outputs, and potential use cases.
This file documents the Wolfram LLM API integration, specifically detailing a block for querying Wolfram Alpha's computational knowledge engine with natural language questions.

This document describes Stagehand blocks for AI-powered browser automation. It details blocks for performing actions, extracting data, and observing elements on web pages using Stagehand and Browserbase.
This directory is intended to house documentation for the 'fal' block integration within the AutoGPT project. It would contain information on how to set up and utilize 'fal' as a modular integration.

This file defines an AI-powered condition block (`AIConditionBlock`) that evaluates natural language conditions using a large language model (LLM) and provides conditional outputs based on the AI's 'true' or 'false' determination.

This file defines a `CodeGenerationBlock` for AutoGPT, enabling interaction with OpenAI's Codex models via the Responses API to generate or refactor code based on user prompts and configured parameters.

This file defines an AutoGPT block responsible for creating short-form videos from text scripts. It integrates with the Revid API to generate videos using stock or AI imagery, incorporating options for aspect ratio, resolution, audio tracks, AI voices, and visual styles.

This file defines an AIImageCustomizerBlock that enables generating and editing images using Google Gemini models (like Nano-Banana) via the Replicate platform, taking a prompt and optional input images.

This file defines a `PerplexityBlock` class for integrating Perplexity's sonar models via OpenRouter API, enabling users to query the models and receive annotated responses with source citations. It handles API calls, input/output processing, and credential management for Perplexity model interactions.

This file defines a `ClaudeCodeBlock` for executing tasks using Anthropic's Claude Code AI assistant within an E2B sandbox environment. It allows for complex coding tasks, file manipulation, and command execution in a secure, autonomous manner.
This file defines modular blocks for interacting with the Pinecone vector database, enabling initialization of indexes, querying data, and inserting (upserting) new vectors and their metadata.

This file defines a backend block for interacting with the Ideogram AI image generation service. It allows users to generate images using various Ideogram models and parameters, with an option to upscale the generated images.

This file defines a `Block` that integrates with BlackForest Labs' Flux Kontext models via the Replicate API, allowing users to perform AI-powered image editing based on a text prompt and an optional input image. It handles model execution, moderation, and storage of the generated image.

This file defines the `SmartDecisionMakerBlock`, a core component that uses a language model to make intelligent decisions, manage tool calls and responses, and handle conversational history within an agentic system. It includes utilities for processing LLM outputs and integrating various tool interaction formats.
This file defines a text-to-speech block for the AutoGPT platform that integrates with the Unreal Speech API. It converts input text into an MP3 speech file and provides its URL.

This file defines a `CreateTalkingAvatarVideoBlock` that integrates with the D-ID API to generate talking avatar video clips from text inputs. It handles the video creation process, including polling for completion and returning the final video URL.

This file defines an enumeration of various Large Language Models (LLMs) from different providers, along with their metadata such as provider name, context window, and pricing tier. It serves as a central registry for LLM configurations used within the application.
This `__init__.py` file serves as the package initializer for the `bannerbear` block, making the `BannerbearTextOverlayBlock` class directly accessible when the `bannerbear` module is imported.
This file defines a reusable block for generating text embeddings using the Jina AI API. It encapsulates the logic for making API requests to Jina's embedding service.

This file defines a `JinaChunkingBlock` class that provides an interface to Jina AI's segmentation service for chunking text. It takes a list of texts and returns segmented chunks, optionally including token information.

This file defines a `FactCheckerBlock` that integrates with Jina AI's Grounding API to assess the factuality of a given statement. It takes a statement and Jina credentials as input, then returns a factuality score, result, reason, and supporting references.

This file integrates the Stagehand web automation library into the AutoGPT backend, defining blocks for observing and interacting with web pages. It includes custom logic for LLM model selection and a monkey patch to manage signal handling in Stagehand across different threads.

This file defines a backend block for AutoGPT that integrates with Nvidia's AI API to detect deepfakes in images. It takes an image as input and returns a deepfake probability, status, and optionally a processed image.

This file defines a `ReplicateModelBlock` that allows running any Replicate AI model with custom inputs and handling credentials. It integrates with the Replicate API to execute models and manage their outputs and potential errors.

This file provides a utility function `extract_result` to normalize and extract a string representation from various output types returned by the Replicate API, such as file URLs, text, or dictionaries.

This file defines a backend block for the AutoGPT platform that integrates with Replicate to run advanced Flux image generation models, allowing users to specify detailed parameters for image creation.
This file defines an AutoGPT platform block (`AskWolframBlock`) that integrates with Wolfram Alpha, allowing users to ask questions and receive answers using an API key.
This file defines an asynchronous function for making API calls to Wolfram Alpha's LLM API, sending a question and an API key to retrieve an answer.

This file contains unit tests for the `SmartDecisionMakerBlock` within the AutoGPT backend, verifying its functionality related to graph validation, tool function signature generation, LLM usage statistics tracking, and tool parameter validation.

This file contains unit tests for the LLM blocks in the backend, specifically verifying that they correctly track token usage statistics and LLM call counts, including scenarios with retries and chunking.

This file contains comprehensive unit tests for the SmartDecisionMakerBlock's handling of dynamic fields, including generation of descriptions and function signatures for dictionary, list, and object dynamic fields for AI model compatibility.

This file provides comprehensive guidance for developers (specifically for the Claude AI assistant) on working with the AutoGPT backend. It covers essential commands, architecture, testing, database schema, environment configuration, common development tasks like adding blocks, modifying the API, and security implementation.
This directory contains a specific database migration script for the AutoGPT backend. Its purpose is to handle the migration related to updating Claude models from version 3.7 to 4.5 Sonnet.

This directory contains a database migration script for the AutoGPT platform's backend. Its purpose is to update database references or configurations to transition from using Claude 3.5 models to Claude 4.5 models.

This directory is intended to house API-related code specifically for transcription services within the frontend application. It would typically contain client-side API routes or utility functions to interact with a backend transcription API endpoint.

This module provides utilities for validating LLM function (tool) calls against defined specifications and converting agent commands into LLM-consumable function specifications. It includes an error class for invalid function calls.
This file defines the integration for the Groq large language model provider, including its supported models, API credentials, and client configuration within the AutoGPT framework.

This file defines the `MultiProvider` class, which acts as a unified interface for multiple large language model (LLM) providers like Anthropic, Groq, Llamafile, and OpenAI. It aggregates their models and methods, allowing seamless interaction with various LLMs through a single entry point.

This document is a comprehensive guide explaining how to create new functional 'blocks' for the AutoGPT Platform using its Software Development Kit (SDK), covering structure, features, and best practices.

This document details the custom OAuth 2.0 integration flow used by the AutoGPT platform to connect to third-party services. It covers the architecture, security measures, component interactions, and credential lifecycle for API integrations, distinguishing it from user authentication.

This document serves as an external API guide for the AutoGPT Platform, detailing how to programmatically interact with agents, blocks, and the store. It covers authentication methods (API keys and OAuth 2.0), available scopes, and provides quick-start examples for API integration.
This document is an integration guide for the AutoGPT Platform, explaining how to use OAuth 2.0 for API access, Single Sign-On (SSO), and connecting third-party services.

This document provides an overview of the 'blocks' used in AutoGPT, which are modular components for building workflows. It lists available blocks categorized by function and offers guidance on creating custom blocks.
This file describes blocks for Discord OAuth2 authentication and for retrieving user information from Discord.

This document provides guidelines for writing and formatting documentation for block manual sections, including 'How It Works' and 'Use Case' sections, for a project's documentation files. It specifies content requirements, examples, and style guidelines.

This file provides Pytest fixtures for setting up test data, including users, chat sessions, agent graphs (general, LLM, Firecrawl), credentials, and store listings, to support integration and unit tests for agent features.

This module defines Pydantic models for exposing integration provider names in the OpenAPI schema, allowing dynamic retrieval of both static and registry-registered providers for frontend consumption.

This file contains unit tests for the `HostScopedCredentials` model, covering its creation, header extraction, URL matching logic (including exact hosts and wildcards), serialization, and deserialization.

This file defines data models and schemas for 'blocks' within the AutoGPT platform, including their types, categories, costs, and validation rules. It uses Pydantic and JSON schema for robust structure definition and validation, particularly for input/output and credential handling.
This file defines data models and provides CRUD and utility functions for managing integration webhooks, linking them to agent nodes and presets within the application's backend.

This file defines a 'BlockInstallationBlock' which enables dynamic installation and verification of other blocks into the system from provided Python code. It highlights a potential security risk as it involves remote code execution and is intended for development use only.

This file is responsible for dynamically discovering, loading, validating, and registering all 'Block' classes defined within the application's 'blocks' directory, ensuring they meet specific structural and configuration requirements.

This file defines data models and helper functions for managing Apollo API key credentials within the backend system. It sets up types for Apollo authentication and provides test credentials for development purposes.

This file implements the OAuth2 handler for Airtable, managing the authorization flow including generating login URLs, exchanging authorization codes for tokens, refreshing tokens, and handling token expiration.
This file defines and configures the Airtable provider for backend blocks, setting up both API key and OAuth authentication, webhook management, and associated costs with specific Airtable scopes.
This file implements the webhook management for Airtable blocks, providing functionalities to validate, register, and deregister webhooks with the Airtable API.
This file configures the Bannerbear service integration, defining its API key requirements and associated operational costs within the backend system.
This file provides test credentials and helper objects specifically for testing Exa blocks within the AutoGPT platform backend. It defines mock API key credentials for testing purposes.
This file implements a webhook manager specifically for the Exa API, handling the validation, registration, and deregistration of webhooks with Exa's service.
This file defines components for handling and filtering webhook events from the Exa API, specifically focusing on webset-related activities like creation, searches, and imports.
This file defines data models and helper functions for handling Discord bot token (API key) and OAuth2 credentials within the AutoGPT platform, including test data.
This file defines a Discord OAuth-based block (`DiscordGetCurrentUserBlock`) designed to retrieve information about the currently authenticated Discord user using OAuth2 credentials.
This module defines credential types and provides mock credentials for integrating with the Enrichlayer API, primarily for testing purposes.

This file defines data structures and helper functions for handling Fal.ai API key credentials, including mock data for testing purposes. It integrates Fal.ai credentials into the backend's credential management system.

This file defines shared configuration for Linear blocks, including API key and OAuth setup using the SDK pattern, and lists the available OAuth scopes. It also includes mock credentials for testing purposes.

This file implements the OAuth2 handler for the Linear API, managing authentication flows such as generating login URLs, exchanging codes for tokens, revoking tokens, and handling the migration of old long-lived tokens to new refresh-token-based ones.
This file defines data structures and functions for managing Jina API key credentials within the backend system, including type definitions and test credentials.

This file defines data models and utility functions for handling GitHub authentication credentials, supporting both API key and OAuth2 methods, and providing credential input configurations for backend blocks.
This file defines the data models and helper functions for managing HubSpot API key credentials, including structures for input and mock data for testing purposes.
This file configures the 'stagehand' provider, including its API key requirement and base cost for execution, using the ProviderBuilder pattern from the backend SDK.
This file defines data models and helper functions for handling NVIDIA API key credentials, including testing credentials and a function to describe the required API key field.
This file defines data models and utilities for Notion OAuth2 credentials, including configuration checks, credential input fields, and mock data for testing purposes.
This file defines mock API key credentials for the 'replicate' provider, used for testing purposes, and provides type aliases for Replicate-specific authentication credentials.

This file defines data models and helper functions for handling Twitter OAuth2 credentials within the backend system. It includes types for Twitter credentials, a function to generate credential input fields, and checks for Twitter OAuth configuration.

This file defines types, utility functions, and test data for managing Google OAuth2 credentials within the backend system. It includes checks for Google OAuth configuration and methods to create credential input fields.

This file defines data models and helper functions for handling SmartLead API key credentials, including test credentials and a function to generate a credentials input field for SmartLead integrations.

This file defines data structures, utilities, and test credentials for handling Todoist OAuth2 authentication within the backend system. It provides mechanisms to configure and manage Todoist integration credentials.
This file defines the credential structures and provides test credentials for integrating with the ZeroBounce API, specifically for API key authentication.
This file implements an OAuth2 handler for WordPress, managing the authentication and authorization flow including generating login URLs, exchanging codes for tokens, and validating access tokens.

This file contains comprehensive asynchronous unit tests for the `SendAuthenticatedWebRequestBlock` class, focusing on its integration with host-scoped credentials for HTTP requests. It verifies credential matching (exact and wildcard), header merging, and user-defined header precedence.
This file contains unit tests for backend blocks, specifically validating block availability, block ID format (UUIDv4), and the `auto_credentials` field validation within block schemas.

This file defines the `IntegrationCredentialsManager` class, which handles the lifecycle of integration credentials, including creation, retrieval, updates, and automatic refreshing of OAuth tokens, using Redis-based locking mechanisms to ensure consistency and prevent race conditions.

This file defines an extensible enumeration (`ProviderName`) for various integration provider names. It allows for both predefined providers and custom string values, facilitating flexible integration management within the application.

This file defines system-wide default API keys and other credentials for various integrations and services, and provides a store for managing both these default and user-specific integration credentials within the application's backend.
This file implements the GitHub OAuth handler, providing functionalities for authorizing GitHub applications, exchanging authorization codes for access tokens, refreshing tokens, and revoking tokens.

This file implements the Twitter OAuth 2.0 handler, managing authorization, token exchange, refresh, and revocation processes for Twitter API integration. It provides methods for generating login URLs, obtaining access tokens, and retrieving user information.

This file implements the OAuth 2.0 handler for Notion, managing the authorization flow to obtain access tokens for Notion API integration. It handles generating login URLs and exchanging authorization codes, noting that Notion access tokens are non-expiring and do not support refresh or revocation.

This file defines an abstract base class, `BaseOAuthHandler`, which establishes the interface for handling OAuth authentication flows with various providers. It outlines methods for generating login URLs, exchanging authorization codes for tokens, refreshing tokens, revoking tokens, and managing default scopes.

This file implements the OAuth 2.0 handling for Todoist, providing methods to generate authorization URLs, exchange authorization codes for access tokens, and define Todoist-specific OAuth configurations within the application's backend.

This file implements the Discord OAuth2 handler, managing the authentication flow, including generating login URLs, exchanging authorization codes for tokens, refreshing tokens, and revoking them for Discord integration.
This file implements the Google-specific OAuth 2.0 handling logic, providing functionalities for user authentication, token exchange, token refreshing, and token revocation for Google services.

This file establishes a central registry for OAuth handlers and their credential configurations. It dynamically combines built-in OAuth providers with those registered via an SDK, making them accessible through custom dictionary-like objects.

This file implements the OAuth 2.0 handler for Reddit, enabling applications to authenticate users and manage their access tokens for Reddit services. It handles the full OAuth flow, including generating login URLs, exchanging authorization codes for tokens, refreshing tokens, and revoking access.

This file defines the `BaseWebhooksManager` abstract base class, providing a common interface and core logic for managing webhooks across different providers. It includes methods for creating, retrieving, updating, and deregistering webhooks, as well as abstract methods for provider-specific implementations like payload validation and registration.
This file contains a unit test for the `webhook_ingress_url` utility function, ensuring it correctly constructs webhook ingress URLs based on the application's routing and base URL configuration.

This file is responsible for managing and providing access to different webhook integration managers for various providers (e.g., Compass, GitHub, Slant3D). It dynamically loads these managers and offers functions to retrieve a specific manager or check if a provider supports webhooks.

This file provides utility functions for managing and setting up webhooks within the backend system, including generating ingress URLs and migrating legacy webhook configurations to a new preset-based system.

This file implements the `GithubWebhooksManager` class, which handles the validation, registration, deregistration, and pinging of GitHub webhooks, serving as an integration layer for GitHub-specific webhook interactions.
This file defines a base class for webhook managers where webhooks are registered and deregistered manually or externally, serving as a placeholder or foundation for such integrations.
This file defines lifecycle hooks for graphs and nodes, handling actions upon activation (e.g., credential validation) and deactivation (e.g., detaching and pruning webhooks) within the application.

This file defines a `ProviderBuilder` class, which uses a fluent API to construct and configure `Provider` objects with settings like OAuth, API keys, webhooks, and costs, and registers them in a global registry.

This file defines the `Provider` class, which encapsulates configuration and logic for integrating with external services or platforms (e.g., OpenAI). It manages authentication settings, default credentials, API client factories, and error handling for these providers.

This file implements a central auto-registration system for SDK components, including providers, blocks, OAuth handlers, and webhook managers. It also includes mechanisms to dynamically patch other integration points to utilize these registered components.

This file contains unit tests for the custom exception classes (BlockError and its subclasses) defined in `backend.util.exceptions`, verifying their message formatting, `None` message handling, and inheritance structure.

This file contains unit tests for the AutoGPT SDK, specifically verifying the creation and functionality of various types of blocks, including those with credentials, multiple outputs, and integration with providers, without relying on decorators.

This k6 load test script performs concurrent requests to the core AutoGPT Platform APIs (credits, graphs, and blocks) and validates their responses, acting as a diagnostic and validation test for the API endpoints.
This directory contains a database migration script. Its purpose is to implement a fix for issues related to LLM provider credentials within the `autogpt_platform` backend.

This directory houses a specific database migration script for the AutoGPT platform's backend. It is responsible for applying schema changes related to 'static input link' functionality, as indicated by its timestamped name.

This directory contains a specific database migration script, identified by its timestamp and descriptive name. Its role is to execute a particular database schema change, likely involving the reassigning of block identifiers within the AutoGPT platform's backend.

This directory represents a specific database migration within the AutoGPT platform's backend. Its purpose is to implement a schema change, likely involving the relocation or restructuring of integration credentials and associating them with the `platform.User` model.

This directory likely represents a specific database migration within the AutoGPT platform's backend. Its name suggests it's intended to fix relations related to 'library presets' and is dated for February 27, 2025. This migration would modify the database schema or data to resolve inconsistencies or issues.

This directory is intended to house the database migration script(s) responsible for adding a 'preset webhook relation' to the database schema. Its timestamped name suggests it represents a specific, scheduled database alteration within the application's backend.

This directory represents a specific database migration within the backend, designed to implement or modify permissions related to API key integration. It likely contains the necessary script to update the database schema for this purpose.
This directory represents a specific database migration within the AutoGPT backend. Its purpose is to implement schema changes that add support for OAuth application logos.
This file defines Pydantic models for managing various types of integration credentials (OAuth2, API keys) and OAuth states, including structures for user metadata related to these integrations.
This file serves as a table of contents for AutoGPT documentation, listing an overview of AutoGPT blocks, general guides, and specific block integrations for various platforms and services.

This directory is intended to store publicly accessible static assets related to various third-party integrations for the AutoGPT platform's frontend. It serves as a dedicated location for resources like logos, scripts, or styles that need to be served directly to the client.

This file defines a React component that displays a paginated list of integrations using infinite scrolling. It handles data fetching, loading states, error display, and allows users to select an integration.

This file defines a React hook for fetching and managing a paginated list of integration providers from an API. It handles infinite scrolling, loading states, and error handling for displaying integration options in the UI.
Defines the TypeScript type for messages exchanged after an OAuth authentication popup, detailing either a successful authentication with code and state, or a failure with an error message.

This file implements a setup wizard page that guides users through connecting external service integrations (providers) to their AutoGPT account. It handles parsing integration requests, displaying credential inputs, and redirecting the user upon completion or cancellation.
This file defines the frontend page for a user to view and manage their registered OAuth applications within the AutoGPT Platform.

This React hook (`useOAuthApps`) provides state management and API interactions for displaying and managing a user's OAuth applications, including fetching the list, toggling their active status, and uploading application logos.

This React component displays a list of a user's OAuth applications, showing their details and providing actions to toggle their status (enable/disable) and upload/change their logos. It includes loading states and handles cases where no applications are present.
This file defines the API Keys page for the AutoGPT platform's frontend, displaying and managing a user's API keys. It renders sections for API key management and associated modals.
This file implements the user integrations page in the AutoGPT frontend, displaying a list of connected services and credentials, and allowing users to delete them.

This file defines the third step of the AutoGPT onboarding process, allowing users to select and specify desired integrations or services for AutoGPT to work with. It presents a list of available integrations and an input field for suggesting others.

This file defines a React hook `useCredentials` which is used to retrieve and manage credentials based on a given input schema. It determines the appropriate credential provider, filters available credentials by type and scope, and handles discriminator logic for multi-provider scenarios.
This file defines TypeScript types for integrating with Google services, specifically for Google Tag Manager (GTM) and Google Analytics (GA). It is a partial copy of types from `@next/third-parties`.

This file defines global TypeScript interfaces for interacting with Google APIs, specifically the Google Picker API and Google OAuth2 client, within the frontend application. It declares types for `window.gapi` and `window.google` to enable features like file selection from Google Drive.

This file defines the `GoogleDrivePicker` React component, which provides a UI for users to select files from Google Drive. It handles Google OAuth authentication, credential management, and displays a button to open the Google Drive file picker.

This file defines types and a utility function for reading Google API configuration parameters (client ID, developer key, app ID) from environment variables, intended for use with a Google Drive picker component.

This file provides helper functions for integrating and interacting with Google Drive and Google Identity Services in a frontend application, including script loading, picker view mapping, and response normalization.

This React hook provides functionality to integrate and manage the Google Drive File Picker within an application, handling API loading, OAuth2 authentication, credential management, and file selection.

This component provides an input field for selecting files from Google Drive, supporting both single and multiple selections. It displays the chosen files and allows for their removal, integrating with a Google Drive Picker utility.

This file implements a React component, `CredentialsInput`, that provides a user interface for managing and selecting different types of credentials (e.g., API keys, OAuth, passwords) based on a given schema. It displays existing credentials and facilitates the creation of new ones through various modal forms.

This file contains helper functions, icon mappings, and type definitions for managing and displaying credentials within the frontend application, including logic for OAuth, API keys, and system-managed credentials.

This React hook (`useCredentialsInput`) encapsulates the logic for managing and interacting with various types of user and system credentials (API keys, OAuth2, user/password, host-scoped) within a UI component. It handles selection, deletion, and orchestrates modal states and OAuth flows for credential management.

This file defines a React component, `OAuthFlowWaitingModal`, which displays a modal dialog informing the user to complete an OAuth sign-in process in a separate pop-up window and warns that closing the modal will cancel the operation.

This file defines a React modal component (APIKeyCredentialsModal) that allows users to input and add new API key credentials, including a title, the API key itself, and an optional expiration date, for different services within the AutoGPT platform.

This file defines a React hook (`useAPIKeyCredentialsModal`) that manages the form logic, validation, and submission for creating API key credentials within a modal. It handles API key input, title, and expiration date, interacting with a `useCredentials` hook to create new credentials.

This React component, `CredentialRow`, is responsible for displaying a single credential's information, including its provider icon, display name, and a masked key. It supports various interactive states such as selection, deletion via a dropdown menu, and different display modes for read-only or selection purposes.

This file defines a React modal component (`PasswordCredentialsModal`) that allows users to input and save new username and password credentials for a specified service provider. It includes form validation and integration with a credentials management hook to create new user login entries.
